se.chalmers.ait.dat215.project
Class IMatDataHandler

java.lang.Object
  se.chalmers.ait.dat215.project.IMatDataHandler

public class IMatDataHandler
extends java.lang.Object

The IMatDataHandler class is a common facade for most functionality of the iMat-backend. It takes care of loading and storing shopping data and gives access to other vital components such as the shoppingcart, customer and orders.
The following information is remembered by the IMatDataHandler when an application using it calls the shutdown method:

  • All information in the single Customer object
  • All information in the single CreditCard object
  • All information in the single User object
  • The state of the ShoppingCart, that is all items in the cart
  • All orders that have been placed by the user
The state is restored automatically the next time the IMatDataHandler is created.

Constructor Detail

IMatDataHandler

protected IMatDataHandler()
Constructor that should never be called, use getInstance() instead.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static IMatDataHandler getInstance()
Returns the single instance of the IMatDataHandler class.

shutDown

public void shutDown()
Saves the current state of the IMatDataHandler. Should be called when an application using the IMatDataHandler quits.

isFirstRun

public boolean isFirstRun()
Returns true if this is the first run, false otherwise. Can be useful for displaying special information when an application based on IMatDataHandler is used.

See Also:
resetFirstRun()

resetFirstRun

public void resetFirstRun()
Resets first run to true. Mostly included since this can be useful during development.

See Also:
isFirstRun

isCustomerComplete

public boolean isCustomerComplete()
Returns true if all information about the customer has been given. All is interpreted as name, adress and at least one phone number.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the IMatDataHandler to its initial state. Mostly useful during development.

getCustomer

public Customer getCustomer()
Returns the single customer object holding information about the customer.

getUser

public User getUser()
Returns the single user object holding information about the (optional) user.

getCreditCard

public CreditCard getCreditCard()
Returns the single creditcard object holding information about the customer's creditcard.

getShoppingCart

public ShoppingCart getShoppingCart()
Returns the single shoppingcart object. Changes to the shoppingcart are done using methods in the ShoppingCart class. The IMatDataHandler saves the state of the shoppingcart when it is shutdown and restores it again the next time it is initialized.

placeOrder

public Order placeOrder()
Creates an order from the current contents of the shoppingcart. Also removes the items currently in the shoppingcart. All orders are remembered by the IMatDataHandler. This method is shorthand for placeOrder(true).

Returns:
An Order object containing information about the order.

placeOrder

public Order placeOrder(boolean clearShoppingCart)
Creates an order from the current contents of the shoppingcart. All orders are remembered by the IMatDataHandler.

Parameters:
clearShoppingCart - indicates whether the shopping cart is cleared or not.
Returns:
An Order object containing information about the order.

getOrders

public java.util.List<Order> getOrders()
Return a list of all previous orders

getProduct

public Product getProduct(int idNbr)
Returns the product with the given idNbr.

Parameters:
idNbr - an id number for a specific product.
Returns:
the product with the given id number or null if no such product exists.

getProducts

public java.util.List<Product> getProducts()
Returns a list with all the store's products.

getProducts

public java.util.List<Product> getProducts(ProductCategory pc)
Returns a list with all products in the given product category

findProducts

public java.util.List<Product> findProducts(java.lang.String s)
Returns a list with all products with a name that matches the argument. The search is case-insensitive and all products which have a name where a substring matches the argument are included in the result.

addProduct

public void addProduct(Product p)
Adds a new product to the IMatDataHandler. Mostly included for development purposes. Normally, there should be no reason to call this method.

removeProduct

public void removeProduct(Product p)
Removes a product from the IMatDataHandler. Mostly included for development purposes. Normally, there should be no reason to call this method.

addFavorite

public void addFavorite(Product p)
Adds the product p to the set of favorite products.

addFavorite

public void addFavorite(int idNbr)
Adds the product p with the specified idNbr to the set of favorite products.

removeFavorite

public void removeFavorite(Product p)
Removes the product p from the set of favorited products.

isFavorite

public boolean isFavorite(Product p)
Returns true if the product p is a favorite, false otherwise.

favorites

public java.util.List<Product> favorites()
Returns a list of all favorite products.

hasImage

public boolean hasImage(Product p)
Returns true the given Product object p has an image associated with. Should normally be true for all products.

getImageIcon

public javax.swing.ImageIcon getImageIcon(Product p)
Returns an ImageIcon with a full-sized image for the product P. Most images have the size 800x600 pixels. All images have the ratio 4:3.

Returns:
an ImageIcon or null if no image exists for the specified product.

getImageIcon

public javax.swing.ImageIcon getImageIcon(Product p,
                                          java.awt.Dimension d)
Returns an ImageIcon with the specified Dimension for the product P. All images have the ratio 4:3. The given Dimension can be anything, but if it does not have the ratio 4:3 the result might not look good.

Returns:
an ImageIcon or null if no image exists for the specified product.

getImageIcon

public javax.swing.ImageIcon getImageIcon(Product p,
                                          int width,
                                          int height)
Returns an ImageIcon with the specified width and height for the product P. All images have the ratio 4:3. The given width and height can be anything, but if they do not have the ratio 4:3 the result might not look good.

Returns:
an ImageIcon or null if no image exists for the specified product.

setProductImage

public void setProductImage(Product p,
                            java.io.File f)
Sets the image for the Product p to the contents of the File f. The file should exist and is copied into the IMatDataHandler's storage. Mostly included for development purposes. Normally, there should be no reason to call this method.

imatDirectory

public java.lang.String imatDirectory()
Returns the path to the directory where the IMatDataHandler stores data.
